page.title: 06CHANGING TIMES-1
page.content: Prices fifty years ago,in Marks and Spencers - nothing over 1d,now half a pence.You could buy thirteen buns for a shilling,5 pence.Now you can't buy one for 5 pence.Milk was 2d a pint,1 pence.Now 23 pence a pint.A haircut was 4d,2 pence,now Â£2.00.Petrol was 7 pence a gallon,now Â£2 a gallon.One thing that hasn't changed until recently is the charge for public toilets.For many years this was one pence.Now the charge is five pence. There were no combine harvesters fifty years ago.In 1939 most cottages kept two pigs.They killed one at Christmas, the other was sold.Only farmers keep pigs now.The aerodrome was built in 1941 for the Royal Air Force.Most runways have been dug up.The perimeter has been kept for planes to spray crops.
